content.question: ​A new special attraction opened at a museum. The museum management tracked the number of people who visited the attraction each day and created a function model <math alttext="M"><mi>M</mi></math> for the number of people for each day <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math> after the attraction opened. Each day they also calculated the rate of change of the number of people visiting the attraction. They created a function model <math alttext="R"><mi>R</mi></math> for the rate of change, in people per day, for each day <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math> after the attraction opened. The function <math alttext="R"><mi>R</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="R open parentheses d close parentheses equals 1 over 200 open parentheses negative d to the power of 4 plus 35 d cubed minus 411 d squared plus 1845 d minus 2686.5 close parentheses"><mi>R</mi><mfenced><mi>d</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>200</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>35</mn><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>411</mn><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1845</mn><mi>d</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2686.5</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>. At which of the following values of <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math> does the graph of <math alttext="y equals M open parentheses d close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi><mfenced><mi>d</mi></mfenced></math> have a point of inflection?

topic.text: 1.4: Polynomial Functions and Rates of Change

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
